Order a vector by another vector

Source: R/pal-GEN.R
order_by.Rd

Order a vector by another vector

order_by(x, by)

Arguments

x

The vector to be ordered.
by

The reference vector which x will be ordered by.

Value

A permutation of x.

Examples

# generate 100 random letters
random_letters <-
  letters %>%
  magrittr::extract(sample.int(n = 26L,
                               size = 100L,
                               replace = TRUE)) %T>%
  print()

#>   [1] "c" "d" "m" "f" "n" "b" "y" "e" "s" "r" "e" "j" "l" "d" "s" "x" "t" "y"
#>  [19] "q" "w" "t" "x" "j" "x" "w" "i" "y" "j" "i" "s" "y" "s" "o" "q" "o" "w"
#>  [37] "e" "y" "t" "k" "o" "v" "h" "g" "s" "h" "l" "c" "p" "h" "l" "x" "b" "g"
#>  [55] "r" "z" "a" "u" "z" "b" "i" "y" "k" "a" "p" "w" "o" "k" "t" "a" "y" "y"
#>  [73] "j" "k" "t" "v" "o" "r" "z" "b" "z" "j" "r" "e" "s" "t" "n" "b" "u" "e"
#>  [91] "f" "s" "q" "x" "h" "v" "h" "n" "c" "r"

# sort the random letters alphabetically
random_letters %>% order_by(by = letters)

#>   [1] "a" "a" "a" "b" "b" "b" "b" "b" "c" "c" "c" "d" "d" "e" "e" "e" "e" "e"
#>  [19] "f" "f" "g" "g" "h" "h" "h" "h" "h" "i" "i" "i" "j" "j" "j" "j" "j" "k"
#>  [37] "k" "k" "k" "l" "l" "l" "m" "n" "n" "n" "o" "o" "o" "o" "o" "p" "p" "q"
#>  [55] "q" "q" "r" "r" "r" "r" "r" "s" "s" "s" "s" "s" "s" "s" "t" "t" "t" "t"
#>  [73] "t" "t" "u" "u" "v" "v" "v" "w" "w" "w" "w" "x" "x" "x" "x" "x" "y" "y"
#>  [91] "y" "y" "y" "y" "y" "y" "z" "z" "z" "z"
